cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to stall near or just inland of the coast through the weekend before slowly drifting northeastward toward Louisiana early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast between Port Mansfield and Sargent (near or just north of Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane / Storm Surge watches confined to the lower Texas coast (south of Port Mansfield) – none for Mississippi or Alabama coasts
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm warnings from Port Mansfield to High Island, TX – none extend east of Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact along the Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana; only indirect effects expected east of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of tropical-storm-force winds; any winds at Pascagoula likely below gale-force
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (≤3 ft) possible along Mississippi coast if the large circulation drifts east early next week, but significant surge is unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could deliver 4–7 inches of rain across coastal Mississippi Monday–Wednesday, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in rain-bands early next week; elevated seas and long-period swells could disrupt port operations
